item.title: Crystalline liftability of irregular weights
item.description: arXiv:2506.21637v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $p$ be an odd prime. Let $K/\mathbb{Q}_p$ be a finite unramified extension. Let $\rho: G_K \to GL_2(\overline{\mathbb{F}}_p)$ be a continuous representation. We prove that $\rho$ has a crystalline lift of small irregular weight if and only if it has multiple crystalline lifts of certain specified regular weights. The inspiration for this result comes from work of Diamond-Sasaki on geometric Serre weight conjectures. Our result provides a way to translate results currently formulated only for regular weights to also include irregular weights. The proof uses results on Kisin and $(\varphi,\hat{G})$-modules obtained from extending recent work of Gee-Liu-Savitt to study crystalline liftability of irregular weights.
item.dc:creator: Hanneke Wiersema

item.title: Prime numbers with an almost prime reverse
item.description: arXiv:2506.21642v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $b$ be an integer greater than or equal to $2$. For any integer $n\in \left[b^{\lambda-1}, b^{\lambda}-1\right]$, we denote by $R_\lambda (n)$ the reverse of $n$ in base $b$, obtained by reversing the order of the digits of $n$. We establish a Bombieri-Vinogradov type theorem for the set of the reverses of the prime numbers. Combined with sieve methods, this permits us to prove that there exist $\Omega_b\in\mathbb{N}$ and $c_b>0$ such that, for at least $c_b b^{\lambda} \lambda ^{-2}$ primes $p\in \left[b^{\lambda-1}, b^{\lambda}-1\right]$, the reverse $R_\lambda(p)$ has at most $\Omega_b$ prime factors. Some explicit admissible values of $\Omega_b$ are given.
item.dc:creator: C\'ecile Dartyge, Jo\"el Rivat, Cathy Swaenepoel

item.title: Rational connectedness for groups of proper projective similitudes
item.description: arXiv:2506.21717v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: For a quadratic form $\varphi$ over a field of characteristic different from $2$, we study whether its group of proper projective similitudes ${\bf PSim}^+(\varphi)$ is rationally connected (i.e. $R$-trivial). We obtain new sufficient conditions in terms of structure properties of $\varphi$. We further provide new examples of quadratic forms $\varphi$ belonging to a given power of the fundamental ideal in the Witt ring and such that ${\bf PSim}^+(\varphi)$ is not rationally connected.
item.dc:creator: M. Archita, Karim Johannes Becher

item.title: On the Generalised Divisor Problem
item.dc:creator: Sebastian Tudzi

item.title: Rectangular representations and $\lambda$-independence of algebraic monodromy groups
item.description: arXiv:2506.21941v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $\mathfrak g$ be a complex semisimple Lie algebra. We define what it means for a finite dimensional representation of $\mathfrak g$ to be rectangular and completely classify faithful rectangular representations. As an application, we obtain new $\lambda$-independence results on the algebraic monodromy groups of compatible systems of $\lambda$-adic Galois representations of number fields.
item.dc:creator: Chun-Yin Hui, Wonwoong Lee

item.title: Computing Hilbert modular forms as orthogonal modular forms
item.description: arXiv:2506.21981v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show how to efficiently compute Hilbert modular forms as orthogonal modular forms, generalizing and expanding upon the method of Birch.
item.dc:creator: Jeffery Hein, Gonzalo Tornaria, John Voight

item.title: A Study of Fine Selmer Groups Over Function Fields via Greenberg Neighbourhoods
item.description: arXiv:2506.22002v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Greenberg examined the local behavior of Iwasawa invariants as functions on the the set of all $\mathbb{Z}_p$-extensions of a number field $F$. Kleine later extended these ideas to explore the variation of Iwasawa invariants in the context of Selmer groups of elliptic curves across different $\mathbb{Z}_p$-extensions of $F$. Let $K$ be a global function field of characteristic $p$. In this article, we investigate the relation between Iwasawa invariants of fine Selmer groups of an elliptic curve over $K$ across various $\mathbb{Z}_p$-extensions of $K$, utilizing Kleine's techniques. Furthermore, we connect this analysis to an analogue of Conjecture A by Coates and Sujatha for different $\mathbb{Z}_p$-extensions of the function field $K$.
item.dc:creator: Sohan Ghosh

item.title: On twisted period functions and Moments of a weighted mean square of Dirichlet L-functions on the critical line
item.description: arXiv:2506.22014v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We extend to Dirichlet L-functions associated with arbitrary primitive characters a range of objects and properties -- including Eisenstein series and period functions -- that were originally introduced and studied by Lewis and Zagier (2001), and later by Bettin and Conrey (2013) in the case of the Riemann zeta function, and more recently by Lewis and Zagier (2019) for odd real characters. These tools yield closed-form expressions for the moments of a measure defined via a weighted mean square of the L-function. These moments not only provide a complete characterization of the modulus of the L-function on the critical line, but also imply an infinite number of non-trivial positivity conditions valid for all primitive characters, real or not. The methods also involve a general form of an asymptotic formula based on the shifted Euler--Maclaurin summation formula, which may be of independent interest.
item.dc:creator: Sebastien Darses (I2M, CRM, IRL CRM-CNRS), Berend Ringeling (CRM), Emmanuel Royer (LMBP, CRM, IRL CRM-CNRS)

item.title: Integers for Simple Radical and for Linearly Disjoint Extensions
item.description: arXiv:2506.22102v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The ring of integers and its discriminant is determined for simple radical extensions and for linearly disjoint extensions. For simple radical extensions it is determined explicitly. For linearly disjoint extensions it is reduced to the determination of the integers and its discriminant for subfields which do not have a linearly disjoint decomposition. The results include the prime 2.
item.dc:creator: Julius Kraemer

item.title: Mean value theorems with smooth numbers
item.description: arXiv:2506.22192v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We obtain new mean value theorems for exponential sums with very smooth numbers, which provide a power saving against the trivial bound in region where previous bounds do not apply.
item.dc:creator: F. Majeed, Igor E. Shparlinski

item.title: Mean squares of quadratic twists of the Fourier coefficients of modular forms
item.description: arXiv:2506.22256v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we evaluate asymptotically a smoothed version of the sum \[ \displaystyle \sideset{}{^*}\sum_{d \leq X} \left( \sum_{n \leq Y} \lambda_f(n)\Big(\frac{8d}{n}\Big)\right)^2, \] where $\Big ( \frac{8d}{\cdot}\Big )$ is the Kronecker symbol, $\sideset{}{^*}\sum$ denotes a sum over positive odd square-free integers and $\lambda_f(n)$ are Fourier coefficients of a given modular form $f$.
item.dc:creator: Peng Gao, Yuetong Zhao

item.title: Distinguishing Siegel modular forms
item.description: arXiv:2506.22264v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $f$ and $f'$ be genus $2$ cuspidal Siegel paramodular newforms. We prove that if their Hecke eigenvalues $a_p$ and $a_p'$ satisfy a non-trivial polynomial relation $P(a_p, a_p') = 0$ for a set of primes $p$ of positive density, then $f$ and $f'$ are twists of each other by a Dirichlet character. In particular, if both forms have trivial nebentypus, then they differ by a quadratic twist. This result extends the strong multiplicity one theorem, which handles the case $P(x,y) = x - y$, to arbitrary polynomial relations. Our proof analyses the image of the product Galois representation attached to the pair $(f, f')$: we show that this image is as large as possible, unless $f$ is a twist of $f'$. Our results also apply to elliptic modular forms. They therefore provide a unified method for distinguishing both elliptic and Siegel modular forms based on their Hecke data, including their Hecke eigenvalues, Satake parameters, Sato--Tate angles, and the coefficients of their $L$-functions. We apply our methods to recover and generalise a range of existing results and to prove new ones in both the elliptic and Siegel settings.
item.dc:creator: Arvind Kumar, Ariel Weiss

item.title: Hawaii conjecture through the lens of Cauchy indices
item.description: arXiv:2506.22330v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Given a real polynomial $p$, we study some properties of real critical points of its logarithmic derivative $Q[p]=(p'/p)'$ using the theory of Cauchy indices. As a by-product we improve the lower bound for the number these points.
item.dc:creator: Dmitry Gnatyuk, Mikhail Tyaglov

item.title: Classification of distinguished representations of GL(2)
item.description: arXiv:2506.22097v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Let $F$ be a non-archimedean local field with odd residual characteristic, and let $H$ be a maximal torus of ${\rm GL}_2(F)$. In this paper, we will classify the irreducible $H$-distinguished representations of ${\rm GL}_2(F)$ by using Casselman's criteria for $p$-adic symmetric spaces developed by Kato-Takano.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Matsumoto

item.title: The Square-Root Law Does Not Hold in the Presence of Zero Divisors
item.description: arXiv:2405.13248v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $R$ be a finite ring (with unit, not necessarily commutative) and define the paraboloid $P = \{(x_1, \dots, x_d)\in R^d|x_d = x_1^2 + \dots + x_{d-1}^2\}.$ Suppose that for a sequence of finite rings of size tending to infinity, the Fourier transform of $P$ satisfies a square-root law of the form $|\hat{P}(\chi)|\leq C|R|^{-d}|P|^\frac{1}{2}$ for some fixed constant $C$ (for instance, if $R$ is a finite field, this bound will be satisfied with $C = 1$). Then all but finitely many of the rings are fields. Most of our argument works in greater generality: let $f$ be a polynomial with integer coefficients in $d-1$ variables, with a fixed order of variable multiplications (so that it defines a function $R^{d-1}\rightarrow R$ even when $R$ is noncommutative), and set $V_f = \{(x_1, \dots, x_d)\in R^d|x_d = f(x_1, \dots, x_{d-1})\}$. If (for a sequence of finite rings of size tending to infinity) we have a square root law for the Fourier transform of $V_f$, then all but finitely many of the rings are fields or matrix rings of small dimension. We also describe how our techniques let us see that certain varieties do not satisfy a square root law even over finite fields.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Kingsbury-Neuschotz

item.title: Determining all biunitary triperfect numbers of a certain form
item.description: arXiv:2406.19331v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We shall show that $2160$ is the only biunitary triperfect number divisible by $27=3^3$.
item.dc:creator: Tomohiro Yamada

item.title: On the unit group of some multiquadratic fields
item.description: arXiv:2501.15591v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper, we calculate the unit groups and the $2$-class numbers of the fields $ \mathbb{K}= \mathbb{Q}(\sqrt{2}, \sqrt{p_1}, \sqrt{p_2})$ and $ \mathbb{L}= \mathbb{Q}( \sqrt{-1},\sqrt{2}, \sqrt{p_1}, \sqrt{p_2})$, where $p_1$ and $p_2$ are two prime numbers satisfying $p_1\equiv p_2 \equiv 1 \pmod{4}$.
item.dc:creator: Mohamed Mahmoud Chems-Eddin, Hamza El Mamry

item.title: Mean value of cubic $L$-funcitons with fixed genus
item.description: arXiv:2503.17228v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We investigate the mean value of the first moment of primitive cubic $L$-functions over $\mathbb{F}_q(T)$ in the non-Kummer setting. Specifically, we study the sum \begin{equation*} \sum_{\substack{\chi\ primitive\ cubic\\ genus(\chi)=g}}L_q(\frac{1}{2}, \chi), \end{equation*} where $L_q(s,\chi)$ denotes the $L$-function associated with primitive cubic character $\chi$. Using double Dirichlet series, we derive an error term of size $q^{(\frac{7}{8}+\varepsilon)g}$.
item.dc:creator: Ziwei Hong, Zhongqiu Fang

item.title: On Ihara's lemma for definite unitary groups
item.description: arXiv:2504.07504v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Clozel, Harris, and Taylor proposed a conjectural generalized Ihara's lemma for definite unitary groups. In this paper, we prove their conjecture with banal coefficients under some conditions. As an application, we prove a level-raising result for automorphic forms associated to definite unitary groups.
item.dc:creator: Xiangqian Yang

item.title: Sums of infinite series involving the Dirichlet lambda function
item.description: arXiv:2504.08347v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The Dirichlet lambda function $\lambda(s)$ is defined for $\mathrm{Re}(s) > 1$ by \[ \lambda(s) = \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{(2n+1)^s}. \] This function was initially studied by Euler on the real line, where he denoted it by $N(s)$. In this paper, by applying the partial fraction decomposition of $\pi \tan(\pi x)$ and explicit evaluations of the integrals \[ \int_0^{\frac{1}{2}} x^{2m-1} \cos(2l\pi x) dx \quad \text{and} \quad \int_0^{\frac{1}{2}} x^{m-1} \log \cos(\pi x) dx, \] for positive integers $l$ and $m$, we derive closed-form expressions for several classes of infinite series involving $\lambda(s)$. We also demonstrate that the values $\lambda(k)$ for even integers $k \geq 2$ arise as constant terms in the Fourier expansions of Eisenstein series associated with the congruence subgroup \[ \Gamma_0(2) := \left\{ \begin{pmatrix} a & b c & d \end{pmatrix} \in \operatorname{SL}_2(\mathbb{Z}) : c \equiv 0 \pmod{2} \right\}. \]
item.dc:creator: Su Hu, Min-Soo Kim

item.title: On Primes of Ordinary and Hodge-Witt Reduction
item.description: arXiv:1603.09404v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Jean-Pierre Serre has conjectured, in the context of abelian varieties, that there are infinitely primes of good ordinary reduction for a smooth, projective variety over a number field. Any prime of ordinary reduction is also a prime of Hodge-Witt reduction but not conversely. More generally, Conjecture 4.1.2 asserts the existence of infinitely many primes of Hodge-Witt reduction. The two conjectures are related but not equivalent (Theorem 4.1.4). We prove this conjecture for abelian threefolds Theorem 4.3.1 (joint with C. S. Rajan), and smooth Fano threefolds (Theorem 4.4.9) and in Theorem 4.5.4 for all simple abelian varieties with complex multiplication (this implies a conjecture of Musta\c{t}\u{a}-Srinivas for such abelian varieties). We show that the set of primes of ordinary and Hodge-Witt reduction can have different densities (Theorem 4.5.4, Example 6.3.1). Theorem 6.2.1 asserts that for Fermat hypersurfaces of dimension $\geq 3$ and degrees $\geq 211$, at least 98% of the primes are of non Hodge-Witt (and hence non-ordinary) reduction. We include here an unpublished joint result Theorem 3.3.1 with C. S. Rajan.
item.dc:creator: Kirti Joshi

item.title: Discrete maximal operators and pinned simplices
item.description: arXiv:2301.11359v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove $\ell^2$ estimates for certain discrete maximal operators associated to simplices. These operators are generalizations of the discrete spherical maximal operator.
item.dc:creator: Neil Lyall, Akos Magyar, Alex Newman, Peter Woolfitt

item.title: Endoscopic decomposition of elliptic Fargues-Scholze L-packets
item.description: arXiv:2503.00621v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The main goal of this note is to show that the local L-packet of Fargues-Scholze [FS], corresponding to an elliptic L-parameter, has an endoscopic decomposition. Our argument is strongly motivated by a beautiful paper of Chenji Fu [Fu], where the stable case is proven. To put our results in a more general context, we also formulate a general endoscopic decomposition over complex numbers based on results of Arthur, and suggest a conjectural generalization of this decomposition over an arbitrary algebraically closed field of characteristic zero.
item.dc:creator: David Kazhdan, Yakov Varshavsky
